enum.name: gimbal_control_mode
enum.description: Gimbal control mode. Used in *set_gimbal_control_mode* command.

entry.name: poi
entry.description: Gimbal attitude is controlled by *poi* command

entry.name: absolute
entry.description: Gimbal attitude is controlled by *set_gimbal_attitude* command

entry.name: direct
entry.description: Gimbal attitude is controlled by *direct_payload_control* command from GS

entry.name: manual
entry.description: Gimbal attitude is controlled by user via seperate channel (eg. RC)

command.name: waypoint
command.description: Specifies the next waypoint. Upon encountering this item vehicle starts navigating to given coordinates using current speed and heading settings. Next mission item will be executed when vehicle arrives at the waypoint.
command.field: Turn type. Enum values are vehicle specific.

command.name: set_failsafe
command.description: What to do when various failsafe events occur. Each supported failsafe event maps to a list of available failsafe actions. Can contain both: hardcoded values (See Failsafe actions natively supported by UgCS) or user defined values.
command.field: List of available failsafe actions when RC link loss is detected.
List of available failsafe actions when Ground Station link loss is detected.
List of available failsafe actions when GPS signal is lost.
List of available failsafe actions when main power supply is running low.
List of available failsafe actions when main power supply is at critical level.

command.name: set_gimbal_control_mode
command.description: Activates gimbal control mode. The selected mode is active until another gimbal_control_mode command or mission item is encountered. I.e. it can span multiple waypoints.
